page.title: 09Forestry on Todmorden Moor
page.content: In the past it was likely that the whole area was forested but this has long since disappeared. There have been moves in recent years to replace a lot of the woodland and this has been a twofold effort. The{Forestry Commission}has planted large tracts of land on the top of the moor with{pine plantations}and on the valley sides (particularly noticeable on the Burnley Road side near the recreation ground) there have been attempts by individuals and the local authority to replant the hillsides with deciduous trees for the benefit of future generations. Most of this hillside planting has taken place since 1982.
